title.narrative: African Development Bank (AfDB) 7th General Capital Increase

description.narrative: The Governors of AfDB mandated the Bank to start negotiations on the 7th capital Increase in the annual meeting in 2018. The decision on the 125 % capital Increase was approved 31.10.2019 in Abidjan. With this Capital Increase the Bank is able to increase its lending to 86 billion euros yearly. AfDB's priorities are aligned with the Agenda 2030 and SDGs as well as Finland's development policy priorities. 40 % of the Bank's resources are counted as climate finance 50 % of this mitigation and 50 % adaptation . The shareholders of the Bank will pay in 6 % of the capital increase and 94 % will be callable capital. Finland will subscribe 39248 shares which is equal to 0469 % shareholding. This is equal to paid in capital of 23 550 000 UA (295 MEUR) and callable capital of 368 930 000 UA (460 834 155 EUR)
